contentrichtext.text: In [[mathematics]], a '''semiperfect magic cube''' is a [[magic cube]] that is not a [[perfect magic cube]], i.e., a magic cube for which the [[cross section (geometry)|cross section]] diagonals do not necessarily sum up to the cube's [[magic constant]]. ==References== *{{citation|title=The Zen of Magic Squares, Circles, and Stars: An Exhibition of Surprising Structures across Dimensions|first=Clifford A.|last=Pickover|authorlink=Clifford A. Pickover|publisher=Princeton University Press|year=2003|page=98|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=-mu8O8RMG6QC&pg=PA98}}. [[Category:Magic squares]] {{combin-stub}}
